bibl.title: Hazzard v. Aguirre and Price. Petition for Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Pierce } ss.

George Hazard, being duly sworn, says that he is the petitioner named in and who signed the foregoing petition, that he has read said petition and knows the contents thereof, and that it is true of his own knowledge except those facts therein alleged upon information or belief, and that as to those facts therein alleged upon information or belief, and this as to those facts that he believes them to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this October, 6, 1889 Herbert S. Griggs Notary Public for Washington Territory
In the matter of the application of George Hazard for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed Oct. 6th 1889 H Reeves Hynes Clerk District Court
